cards.dialogueFragment: I understand your situation. You're not alone in this.
I've been through something similar. Let me share what helped me.
You know you can count on me. We've been through too much together.
Take a breath. We'll work through this together.
I need to confess something... I trust you enough to be completely honest.
We've built something here, haven't we? This trust between us.
Please, you have to understand!
We have time. Let's work through this together.
Please, tell me more. I'm listening carefully.
I'm here for you. Whatever you need.
First, let me set the context...
I'm open to hearing your perspective.
I need to be completely honest with you about something...
You're stronger than you know. I believe in you.
That seems like a fair arrangement for both of us.
Think of the profit potential! This could make us both wealthy.
My business connections speak highly of you. Let's make this profitable.
This is my final offer. Take it or leave it.
Let me lay out my case systematically.
I have a business proposition that could benefit us both.
I know something about the market trends that might interest you.
There are things about this trade that others don't know...
Perhaps we can adjust the terms to suit both parties.
I think we have the basis for a solid agreement here.
When we both profit, we both win.
Let me show you the numbers - they speak for themselves.
The timing is perfect for this opportunity - but it won't last.
This gives us a significant advantage over our competitors.
Let me think about what you've said...
I feel we're making progress here.
Let's take this one step at a time.
We have more in common than we might think.
Slow and steady often wins the day.
Let's keep our attention on what matters most.
Now is the time to move forward decisively.
Good things take time. Let's make sure we have it.
We both know what's right. Let's do our duty.
Let me speak plainly - no fancy words needed.
You can count on me to be there when needed.
Experience has taught me a few things about situations like this.
The path forward is clear. We just need to take the first step.
My resolve is unshakeable. This is how it must be.
Your reputation precedes you. It's an honor to speak with you.
Let us observe the proper protocols, as befits your station.
Your standing in society demands this consideration.
I know things that others don't. Perhaps we can help each other.
I have information that could be... useful to you.
It would be unfortunate if certain information became public.
Wait, let me say something...
This is my final word on the matter.
Let me respond quickly to that.
Give me a moment to consider this properly.
No, no, no... you don't understand! Lord Blackwood leaves at sunset. If this letter doesn't reach him, my father will sign the marriage contract tonight!
3 coins for a hot meal. Fair price.
5 coins for a room and a good night's rest.
5 coins for rations. Fair price in this market.
10 coins for travel supplies.
3 coins for a hot meal. Best stew in the district!
5 coins for a clean room and a good night's rest.
2 coins for our finest ale. It'll ease your troubles.
10 coins for a day pass to the Noble District. Don't cause trouble.

npcs.name: Elena
npcs.description: Clutching her sealed letter, eyes darting to the door with each sound
npcs.personality: Desperate about Lord Blackwood's marriage proposal - he leaves at sunset

locations.name: Market Square
locations.description: The bustling heart of the city. Cobblestones worn smooth by countless feet.

locations.name: Copper Kettle Tavern
locations.description: A warm, inviting tavern. The copper kettle hangs over the hearth, giving the place its name.

locations.name: Noble District
locations.description: Quiet streets lined with grand estates. Guards patrol regularly.

locations.name: City Gates
locations.description: Guards check papers. Travelers rest before journeys. The road stretches beyond.

spots.name: Corner Table
spots.description: A quiet table in the corner, perfect for private conversations and intimate gatherings.
spots.initialState: A small wooden table with two chairs. Dimly lit and away from the main crowd.

spots.name: The Fountain
spots.description: The ornate fountain at the heart of Market Square. A gathering place for all.
spots.initialState: Clear water sparkles in the light. Citizens gather on benches around the fountain's edge.

spots.name: Lord Blackwood's Estate
spots.description: A grand estate known for hosting influential gatherings and political dealings.
spots.initialState: Impressive architecture with tall windows. The sound of a fountain echoes from within.

spots.name: Merchant Row
spots.description: Rows of market stalls selling goods from across the realm
spots.initialState: Merchants are setting up their wares, calling out to potential customers

spots.name: Ferry Dock
spots.description: A wooden dock where the city ferry operates, connecting to routes across the water.
spots.initialState: The ferry bobs at the dock. Passengers wait with their belongings while the ferryman prepares.

spots.name: Main Hall
spots.description: The heart of the Copper Kettle Tavern. Tables and chairs fill the space, with a warm fire crackling.
spots.initialState: The hearth glows warmly. Patrons sit at wooden tables, enjoying food and drink.

spots.name: Bar Counter
spots.description: The polished wooden bar where Bertram serves drinks and meals to guests.
spots.initialState: Clean glasses line the shelves. Bertram polishes mugs with a friendly smile.

spots.name: Aldwin Manor
spots.description: A stately manor in the Noble District, the main entry point from the central gates.
spots.initialState: Elegant architecture and manicured grounds. Guards patrol the perimeter.

spots.name: Upstairs Room
spots.description: A private room above the tavern's main hall, available for rent.
spots.initialState: A simple room with a bed and washbasin. Clean and ready for guests.

spots.name: North Entrance
spots.description: The northern entrance to Market Square, where merchants enter from the trade routes.
spots.initialState: A wide archway with merchants and travelers passing through.

spots.name: North Alcove
spots.description: A quiet alcove near the northern entrance, good for discrete conversations.
spots.initialState: A shadowed area between buildings, away from the main flow of people.

spots.name: Guard Post
spots.description: The official guard station in Market Square where city watch maintain order.
spots.initialState: Guards in uniform stand watch, observing the crowd for any trouble.

spots.name: Gate Entrance
spots.description: The main city gates where travelers and merchants enter and leave the city.
spots.initialState: Massive wooden gates stand open during the day. Guards check papers and cargo.

spots.name: Traveler's Rest
spots.description: A shaded area near the gates where travelers can rest before or after their journeys.
spots.initialState: Wooden benches and water barrels provide comfort for weary travelers.

routes.name: To Copper Kettle
routes.description: A short walk to the tavern.

routes.name: To Noble District (Main Gate)
routes.description: The main gate to the Noble District - requires permit.

routes.name: To Noble District (Merchant Route)
routes.description: A discrete route through merchant alleys.

letterTemplates.description: Elena's urgent refusal of Lord Blackwood's marriage proposal
letterTemplates.narrative: No, no, no... you don't understand! Lord Blackwood leaves at sunset. If this letter doesn't reach him, my father will sign the marriage contract tonight. I'll be trapped forever. Please, I'm begging you!
letterTemplates.consequenceIfLate: Elena forced into unwanted marriage, gains 2 burden cards
letterTemplates.consequenceIfDelivered: Elena's freedom preserved, Trust tokens gained

letterTemplates.narrative: Marcus needs these documents delivered to secure an important trade deal. The package is heavier than it looks.
letterTemplates.consequenceIfLate: Trade deal falls through, Marcus loses 2 Commerce tokens
letterTemplates.consequenceIfDelivered: Profitable trade secured, Commerce tokens gained

observations.name: Guard Patrol Routes
observations.description: You notice the guards follow predictable patterns
observations.dialogueFragment: I've been watching the guards. They change shifts at dawn and dusk.

observations.name: Merchant Gossip
observations.dialogueFragment: The merchants are saying silk prices will rise next week.

observations.name: Busy Crowds
observations.dialogueFragment: The market is so crowded now, no one would notice us talking.

observations.name: Shared Hardship
observations.dialogueFragment: I understand Elena's situation better now. We have more in common than I thought.

observations.name: Merchant Route Knowledge
observations.description: You've learned about the merchant's back route to the Noble District
observations.dialogueFragment: I know a way through the merchant alleys that avoids the guards.

observations.name: Elena's Desperation
observations.description: You understand the urgency of Elena's situation
observations.dialogueFragment: I understand Elena's desperation. Time is running out for her.
